title: Light-Field Imaging 101
text: This tutorial aims to provide a didactic introduction to unfocused light-field (plenoptic 1.0) image processing in Python. While valuable resources exist, including the Light-Field Imaging Toolkit in MATLAB (Bolan et al. 2016) and the informative website plenoptic.info, there remains an opportunity for educational materials that build understanding systematically from first principles. By presenting concepts in a structured, accessible format with Python examples, this guide seeks to complement existing academic literature.

title: Light-Field Imaging 101
text:
Raw images
Throughout this tutorial the following synthetic images will be used. A typical image of the raw light-field as acquired by the sensor


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a simple array
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Simple plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('A Simple Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
